intro: Chrysopsis cruiseana, commonly known as the desert chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers. The plant has a compact, shrub-like growth habit with woody stems and small, gray-green leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chrysopsis cruiseana is adapted to hot, dry environments and is often found in rocky soils and desert scrub habitats.
